newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares gain, Snaige active.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares gain, Snaige active.

text.p: Lithuanian shares gained slightly on Monday and fridge maker Snaige was active, dealers said.
The index of the official trading list gained 23.59 points, moving up to 922.49 points.
The group A index advanced to 2152.62, a gain of 7.87 points, and central market turnover reached 630,000 litas. Block trades raeched one million litas.
"I think the turn around is already starting because the prices are so low," said one broker. "The general trend is up."
Snaige turned over 263,000 litas in block trades on Monday, in what appeared to be heavy interest from an Estonian Bank.
The block trades amounted to 1.7 percent of Snaige's share capital.
"I know that Hansapank bought 5 percent of the company last week, but I don't know who bought 1.7 percent today," said Snaige President Antanas Andrulionis.
One broker said he was certain today's transaction involved an Estonian bank, but he declined to mention which.
"I know it's an Estonian bank," said Tomas Andrejauskas, a broker with Suprema.
Snaige shares soared 29.4 percent last week -- jumping 10 percent on Saturday alone after a large block trade the day before. Saturday was a working day in Lithuania.
Snaige's turnover in block trades last week amounted to 1.2 million litas.
Snaige shares gained 4.55 percent on the central market Monday, moving up to 11.50 litas from 11.00 litas.
Rokishkis Cheese shares also continued to advance, moving up to 43.50 litas from 40.00 litas, on central market turnover of 118,000 litas.
"If the price goes below 45.00 litas a share, it becomes attractive," Andrejauskas said about Rokishkis.
